text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen I've 
got another great fried rice recipe for you

today because let's face it you can't have too 
many fried rice recipes in your pocket so the

one we are making today is called kao pad linjee 
moo dang so Kao pad is fried rice linjee is lychee

or light Chee however you want to call it and 
moo dang is Chinese barbecued pork now I know that

sounds like an odd combination but trust me it is 
out of this world so let's get started so the Li

cheese that I am using today comes from a can and 
can looks like this they're widely available in

so many places now if you can get fresh though 
use fresh because the canned ones I find to be

a little bit too sweet so what I do if you've got 
canned is I just make sure I rinse off the syrup

that comes with it and then I also like to squeeze 
a little bit of lime juice over it because I find

that fresh lychees have a natural tartness to him 
but when they're canned it's like the tartness is

all gone I know what happened to them and it's so 
singularly sweet so I like to give a little bit

back to them it doesn't it to be lime juice could 
be lemon juice as well a shower of acidity and it

brightens it up a little bit and also I'm going 
to just tear these up into sort of bite-sized

pieces so each lychee I tear it up into three or 
four pieces depending on the size just so that

you know you don't get so overwhelmed by lychee 
nests in one bite right so yeah it's something

like that is good and then make sure you do this 
as the first thing in your prep because you want

to give the lychee time to absorb that lime 
juice next let's take a look at our mudang or

our chinese barbecue pork so james BBQ pork is 
something you can get at chinese grocery stores

or you can get it at lots of chinese restaurants 
and you can ask them to buy like a whole piece you

can ask them to cut it for you if you like and 
this is one of those things I like to leave to

the experts cuz it you know it's quite an art 
in and of itself to make these things however

if you don't have it or find it I'll include just 
a simple pork marinade recipe that you can use as

well so I'm gonna cut this into small bite-sized 
pieces and this is why I didn't ask them to cut it

for me because when they cut it for me it's all 
always hacked in some random sized pieces and

make sure also that you don't just get any old 
barbecue pork there are good ones and there are

bad ones okay so make sure you actually like it so 
give it a taste first before we cook as always I'm

gonna mix up my sauce so I don't have to worry 
about it while I'm cooking I've got some soy

sauce here and this is Thai mushroom soy sauce 
healthy boy brand the one that I normally use

but you don't have to use this particular one 
okay the other sauce is golden mountain sauce

which is just another kind of soy sauce it's a 
little richer and has a different flavor you can

use Maggi seasoning instead or you really all you 
have all you have is just one bottle of soy sauce

and you can use the regular soy sauce for both 
just gonna combine them to add a little bit of

color to this fried rice I'm adding some black 
soy sauce and then black soy sauce this is the

brand that I'm using it's dragonfly brand and 
if you don't have it you can use other kinds

of dark soy sauce we just want to get a little 
color going so my dry seasoning I've got some

ground white pepper quite a bit of it because 
I like that he cuz we're not adding any chilies

I've got some sugar here to cut the salt in the 
middle and also some five-spice powder five-spice

powder you can buy from the store or I also have 
a video of how you can make your own it's really

really simple and the reason why I add five-spice 
is because in the Chinese barbecue pork they also

use similar spices that go into five-spice powder 
so I'm sort of tying the flavors together okay so

that's pretty much it for now let's get cooking 
this is where the fun begins okay so I've got a

little bit of oil in the wok here now I'm gonna go 
in with some chopped garlic I love garlic in fried

rice in fact I love garlic and everything so keep 
your eyes on the smallest bits of garlic starts

to turn golden which does not take very long then 
I'm gonna go in with my barbecue pork because it's

old right now so I want to make sure it's hot and 
also the fat from the pork is going to start to

render into the wok and it'll help serve season 
the whole dish so you want to give the pork some

time to be sauteed in the oil okay now I'm going 
to push the pork sort of to one side and add my

eggs I've got two eggs here I love eggs and fried 
rice break the yolk a little bit I'm gonna let it

set sort of halfway because I don't want it to 
be you know complete mush gonna just put the

pork over the egg for now there we go so they can 
sort of mingle and the egg is sort of halfway set

for it getting pretty solid then you can start to 
scramble okay then you get some nice marbled egg

pieces I'm gonna turn up my heat now and I'm gonna 
add my rice now I didn't talk about the rights as

I've talked about rice for fried rice many many 
times if you have trouble with rice being wet a

mushy and fried rice check out my pineapple fried 
rice video I give lots of tips about how you can

make rice that's good for fried rice okay okay 
give that a quick toss get it all mingles with

those ingredients and then I'm gonna add my sauces 
and seasoning so liquid and dry and now you just

worry about tossing making sure all the grains 
are evenly coated if there are any lumps press it

down with your spatula yes I've lost my other wok 
spatula I can't find it so I'm using this plastic

one for now sorry it works just as well so now 
my heat is cranked pretty much all the way and

if you can get your rice even a little bit toasty 
that's better you get smoky toasty flavor so don't

be shy with heat right now okay okay that's almost 
I'm gonna let my rice fit to the toast a little

bit can you hear that crackling yeah that's that 
sound of deliciousness there we go nice toasty bit

okay so now I'm gonna go in with my lychees now 
be careful do not add the lime juice liquid so

just put in the meet leave the liquid behind you 
don't want to get your rice soggy at this point

Animoto gonna ask some cashews a little nuttiness 
to contrast all that fruitiness it's gonna be good

now all you want to do at this point is to warm 
the lychees up 20-30 seconds and when the lychees

get warm they almost get more plump because all 
the juices in the lychee is like getting a little

excited and plumping it up okay and that's it I'm 
gonna turn this off now and I'm gonna dump in a

whole bunch of green onions for some freshness 
and greenery and that's it we're ready to plate

okay let me just clean that up real quick oh I 
can smell the five-spice the white pepper simple

simple garnish okay a little bit of green onions 
on top fried rice in Thailand always comes with

some freshness on the side that you can munch 
on to cut the grease a little bit some cucumber

slices a wedge of lime okay because that is what's 
going to balance the rest of the rice making it

irresistible good and quite a uniquely Thai thing 
to do so if you don't mind I'm going to squeeze a

little lime on top give it a toss and make sure 
I get everything in this fight Oh smells so good

I need a beer with this or something oh there 
is everything going on in here fruitiness from

the lychees and the little tartness also from 
the line with the nuttiness of the cashews and

the chinese barbecue pork just got this sort of 
chewy yet tender texture this really satisfying

to chew on and the aroma of the five-spice 
powder just rounds everything out nicely oh

this is so good you're gonna have a hard time 
stopping eating this thing so I hope you give

this a try the recipe fo ways of young hot Thai 
kitchen calm when you make it send me a photo on

Facebook Twitter or Instagram and don't forget 
to subscribe to the show so you never miss an

awesome recipe like this right here and I will 
see you next time for your next tip it's just
